meanings.definition: Incognito: in disguise or under an assumed character
meanings.sent1: The spy went incog to the masquerade ball, wearing a mask and cloak.
meanings.sent2: She decided to go incog to the party, wearing sunglasses and a hat.
meanings.sent3: The incog detective solved the case without anyone recognizing him.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity went incog at the airport, hoping to avoid the paparazzi.
meanings.sent5: The incog superhero saved the day without revealing their true identity.

meanings.sent1: She traveled incog to the foreign country, keeping her passport hidden.
meanings.sent2: The criminal moved incog through the crowded streets, avoiding detection.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed the trick incog, leaving the audience amazed.
meanings.sent4: The hacker operated incog online, leaving no trace of their activities.
meanings.sent5: The explorer ventured incog into the uncharted jungle, seeking hidden treasures.
